p: Globally, atherosclerosis is the most common reason for morbidity and mortality. It is a multifactorial disease with many different threats ( Joshi et al., 2005). Hyperlipidemia, low-density lipoproteins (LDL), clotting factors and inflammation all collectively contribute to the development of an atherosclerotic plaque ( Dâ€™Souza et al., 2007). It has been illustrated that the volatile oils of N. sativa and its active constituent TQ have valuable results for hyperglycaemia and hyperlipidema ( Ali and Blunden, 2003; Asgary et al., 2013). TQ has been reported to improve hyperlipidemia and protect against the development of atherosclerosis.
